intro: Herpestis tomentosa, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its fruits are inflated pods that contain several seeds, and the leaves are alternate and pinnately divided. It often grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open fields and along roadsides.
